ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Input Via Heritrix Console [1 Attachment]
ygData.msgSnippet: Your screenshot shows a component called AbstractExtractor . That s not a part of the official H1 distribution. Most H1 components *do* allow settings changes

Your screenshot shows a component called 'AbstractExtractor'. That's not 
a part of the official H1 distribution.

Most H1 components *do* allow settings changes even during a running 
crawl via the web console, when such settings make sense to vary after 
launch. (This is one thing that's a bit easier in H1 than H3, though for 
the settings that make sense to change mid-crawl, they can still be 
found and changes via the 'Bean Browse' or 'Script Console' functions.)

Any component, even this 'AbstractExtractor', that shows its settings in 
that web form should respect settings changes that are made *before* a 
crawl is launched. (The setting ought not even appear there otherwise.)

You'll need to ask the author(s) of the AbstractExtractor why things 
aren't behaving as you expect.

- Gordon

On 8/8/12 1:05 PM, David P. Gross wrote:
> [Attachment(s) <#TopText> from David P. Gross included below]
>
> Hi Gordon,
>
> Thanks for your reply.  I am using H1.14.4.  The fields that I am
> changing in particular are keyword, mysql server, mysql database, mysql
> user, mysql password. The control interface you are asking (if I am
> thinking of the same thing) is via xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx:8080 which is the
> heritrix admin console.
>
> I attached a screenshot, but I don't know if it will be accessible
> inside the group.
>
> Based on your questions, I am thinking incorrectly.  I presumed that
> being able to change extractor fields inside the console is standard
> Heritrix function by virtue of the extractor being selected as a
> (writer) processor in the module tab.
>
> I am starting to understand that while I can change Heritrix
> configuration settings within the console, custom extractor specific
> fields though appearing inside the console are not functional without
> additional programming to hand off the changes to the .java file and
> thus recompiling of the extractor.
>
> I figured that since I can copy/paste URL seeds directly into the
> console, I could also change the other fields presented to me as well.
>
> It would be nice to change the fields on the fly inside Heritrix rather
> than going into the .java file for each run requiring new keyword or
> mysql credentials( what I do now).  I realize I'll have to pay for that
> convenience and talk to my developer if I get to the point of doing
> numerous custom keyword/mysql projects.
>
> Thanks for helping me with this insight.
>
> David
